result.execSummary:
The defendant Boyd P Heinitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *If probation revoked, first 30 days to be served in jail and the last 30 days on GPS electronic home monitor, if approved with huber privileges for work or any counseling he may be involved in
*Probation can be transferred to Wood County

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment while on probation

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
*No contact with Walmart in Plover
*Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs 
*Pay restitution if requested by Walmart (no request at the time of sentencing).  **State has 30 days to get statement for restitution and provide to the defense.
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, most recent assessment can be used if it had  been completed within the last 90 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Boyd P Heinitz in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Boyd P Heinitz in custody. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:00 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with victim notification; no victim(s) appear in Court today.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Hess makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 60 day jail sentence - first 30 in jail and the last 30 on GPS electronic home monitor if approved with  huber priviliges for work or counseling he may be involved in
8 days jail credit
Placed on probation for 12 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Probation to be transferred to Wood County
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay restitution if requested by Walmart (no request at the time of sentencing)  **State has 30 days to get statement for restitution and provide to the defense
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, most recent assessment can be used if had been completed within the last 90 days
*Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
*No contact with the Walmart in Plover
*Obtain and maintain full time employment while on probation

20 days to appeal
Pre-trial conference on January 30, 2017 at 08:30 am.
No contact with Walmart.

Defendant Boyd P Heinitz appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court re: status of the case. 
BY THE COURT:  Court quashes the warrant.

Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant is not on a PO Hold.  Makes statements to the Court. 

Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court re: missed appearances by the defendant.  Recommends $100 cash bond with conditions as stated. Will email Atty Halverson with the PTC date that has been set. 

Court advises the defendant to inform the Court of his new address.  Advises what he says can be used against him.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 30, 2017 at 08:30 am.
cc:  DA w/minutes 11/14/16 sp
$500 Alternative - sent to JR ss

Defendant Boyd P Heinitz not in court. Attorney Acalia Halverson is in court for Defendant Boyd Heinitz. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:24 a.m. Court calls the case and states the appearances.
Atty Halverson states unsure location of defendant.
DA Molepske requests Bench Warrant.

BY THE COURT:
Bench Warrant is authorized for defendant's failure to appear. $500.00 cash alternative.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
